filteredMethods.formHtml: Parameters
filteredMethods.summary: List the organizations that the user has privileges on

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

Body Example
 {
    "name": "My organization"
}
filteredMethods.summary: Create a new organization

filteredMethods.formHtml: Parameters
filteredMethods.summary: Return an organization

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

Body Example
 {
    "name": "My organization"
}
filteredMethods.summary: Update an organization

filteredMethods.formHtml: Parameters
filteredMethods.summary: Delete an organization

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

Body Example
 {
    "orders": [
        "4CXXXXXXX"
    ],
    "serials": [
        "Q234-ABCD-5678"
    ],
    "licenses": [
        {
            "key": "Z2XXXXXXXXXX",
            "mode": "addDevices"
        }
    ]
}
filteredMethods.summary: Claim a list of devices licenses and/or orders into an organization. When claiming by order all devices and licenses in the order will be claimed; licenses will be added to the organization and devices will be placed in the organizations inventory.

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

Body Example
 {
    "name": "My organization"
}
filteredMethods.summary: Create a new organization by cloning the addressed organization

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

An optional parameter that is the ID of a config template. Will return all networks bound to that template.

An optional parameter to filter networks by tags. The filtering is case-sensitive. If tags are included, 'tagsFilterType' should also be included (see below).

The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 100000. Default is 1000.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
filteredMethods.example:
[
  [
    {
      "id": "L_123456",
      "organizationId": "2930418",
      "name": "Long Island Office",
      "timeZone": "America/Los_Angeles",
      "tags": [
        "tag1",
        "tag2"
      ],
      "productTypes": [
        "appliance",
        "switch",
        "wireless"
      ],
      "enrollmentString": "long-island-office",
      "notes": "Combined network for Long Island Office"
    }
  ]
]
filteredMethods.summary: List the networks that the user has privileges on in an organization

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

Body Example

    "name": "Long Island Office",
    "timeZone": "America/Los_Angeles",
    "tags": [
        "tag1",
        "tag2"
    ],
    "notes": "Combined network for Long Island Office",
    "productTypes": [
        "appliance",
        "switch",
        "camera"
    ]
}

]

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

Body Example

    "name": "Long Island Office",
    "networkIds": [
        "N_1234",
        "N_5678"
    ]
}

filteredMethods.summary: List the devices in a network

Parameters

Body Example
 {
    "serials": [
        "Q234-ABCD-0001",
        "Q234-ABCD-0002",
        "Q234-ABCD-0003"
    ]
}
filteredMethods.summary: Claim devices into a network. (Note: for recently claimed devices it may take a few minutes for API requsts against that device to succeed)

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

Body Example
 {
    "serial": "Q234-ABCD-5678"
}
filteredMethods.summary: Remove a single device

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 1000.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
filteredMethods.summary: List the status of every Meraki device in the organization

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 365 days from today.

The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 5 minutes after t0. The latest possible time that t1 can be is 2 minutes into the past.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 5 minutes. The default is 5 minutes.

Optional filter for a specific destination IP. Default will return all destination IPs.
filteredMethods.summary: Return the uplink loss and latency for every MX in the organization from at latest 2 minutes ago

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 180 days from today.

The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 7 days after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 7 days.

Filter results by SSID

Filter results by VLAN

Filter results by AP Tag

Partial selection: If present, this call will return only the selected fields of ["rawDistribution", "avg"]. All fields will be returned by default. Selected fields must be entered as a comma separated string.
filteredMethods.summary: Aggregated latency info for a given AP on this network

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 180 days from today.

The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 7 days after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 7 days.

Filter results by SSID

Filter results by VLAN

Filter results by AP Tag

Partial selection: If present, this call will return only the selected fields of ["rawDistribution", "avg"]. All fields will be returned by default. Selected fields must be entered as a comma separated string.
filteredMethods.example:
[
  {
    "backgroundTraffic": {
      "rawDistribution": {
        "0": 1234,
        "1": 2345,
        "2": 3456,
        "4": 4567,
        "8": 5678,
        "16": 6789,
        "32": 7890,
        "64": 8901,
        "128": 9012,
        "256": 83,
        "512": 1234,
        "1024": 2345,
        "2048": 9999
      },
      "avg": 606.52
    },
    "bestEffortTraffic": "same shape as backgroundTraffic",
    "videoTraffic": "same shape as backgroundTraffic",
    "voiceTraffic": "same shape as backgroundTraffic"
  }
]

The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.

filteredMethods.summary: List the clients that have used this network in the timespan

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

A list of client keys, MACs or IPs separated by comma.

The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.

The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.
filteredMethods.summary: Return the application usage data for clients. Usage data is in kilobytes. Clients can be identified by client keys or either the MACs or IPs depending on whether the network uses Track-by-IP.

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

A list of client keys, MACs or IPs separated by comma.

The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.

The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.

      ],

      ],

        "1"

      ],

        "Two-port MAC Relay"

    "cdp": null,
    "status": "Online"

]
filteredMethods.summary: Return the client associated with the given identifier. Clients can be identified by a client key or either the MAC or IP depending on whether the network uses Track-by-IP.

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
filteredMethods.summary: Return the clients network traffic data over time. Usage data is in kilobytes. This endpoint requires detailed traffic analysis to be enabled on the Network-wide > General page. Clients can be identified by a client key or either the MAC or IP depending on whether the network uses Track-by-IP.

filteredMethods.formHtml: Parameters
filteredMethods.summary: Return the clients daily usage history. Usage data is in kilobytes. Clients can be identified by a client key or either the MAC or IP depending on whether the network uses Track-by-IP.

filteredMethods.formHtml: Parameters
filteredMethods.summary: Returns live state from camera of analytics zones

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 365 days from today.

The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 7 days after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 7 days. The default is 1 hour.
filteredMethods.summary: Returns an overview of aggregate analytics data for a timespan

filteredMethods.formHtml: Parameters
filteredMethods.summary: Returns most recent record for analytics zones

filteredMethods.formHtml: Parameters
filteredMethods.summary: Returns all configured analytic zones for this camera

filteredMethods.formHtml:
Parameters

The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 365 days from today.

The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 14 hours after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 14 hours. The default is 1 hour.

The time resolution in seconds for returned data. The valid resolutions are: 60. The default is 60.

filteredMethods.summary: Generate a snapshot of what the camera sees at the specified time and return a link to that image.

name: Camera SN for testing
info:
If you dont have an organization with a MV camera available for this flow testing, you can use below serial number. Kindly please be noticed, due to some speical settings of the demo networks, it's expected that MV snapshot endpoint wouldn't work on other cameras on Meraki Launchpad.


> # **SN: Q2NV-S6M5-5XG4**

In your Node-RED dashboard, select 'San Francisco' from network dropdown list, then in MV sense group use the camera with 'SNAPSHOT-API-DEMO' in name and click SNAPSHOT button.
